adjectives.description: extra (not generally comparable, comparative more extra, superlative most extra)

entries.meaning: (not comparable) Beyond what is due, usual, expected, or necessary; extraneous; additional; supernumerary.
examples: I don't mind doing some extra work, as long as I get extra pay.

entries.meaning: (comparable, slang) Over the top; going beyond what is normal or appropriate, often in a dramatic manner.
examples: You unfollowed her for posting cat memes? You're so extra!
Wow, you're more extra than she is. You're the most extra friend I have.
That day he ran to school extra fast.

entries.meaning: Something additional, such as an item above and beyond the ordinary school curriculum, or added to the usual charge on a bill.
An extra edition of a newspaper, which is printed outside of the normal printing cycle, for example to report an important late-breaking event.
examples: Extra, extra! Read all about it!

entries.meaning: (cricket) A run scored without the ball having hit the striker's bat - a wide, bye, leg bye or no ball.
(acting) A supernumerary or walk-on in a film or play.
(slang) The state or trait of being over the top, of behaving in an overly dramatic manner.
examples: Stop! I can't deal with all your extra today!

entries.meaning: Something of an extra quality or grade.
